events.name: Business Change
events.ta1explanation: Schema describing business change events, including fraud, mergers and acquisitions, antitrust investigations, and bankruptcy

events.name: Early Stages
events.description: Early stages container
events.ta1explanation: Events happening in the early stages of a business

events.name: Corruption
events.ta1explanation: Some form of corruption happens amongst the people in the business

events.name: Fraud
events.description: Fraud container
events.ta1explanation: Types of business fraud

events.name: Audit
events.description: Type of audit conducted to ensure "financial statements" are in accordance with specified criteria
events.ta1explanation: Regular audit to verify financial records

events.name: Criminal investigation
events.ta1explanation: Financial records could not be validated, a criminal investigation case is opened

events.name: Market Shift
events.description: Market shift container
events.ta1explanation: Events leading to the business suffering economically

events.name: Restructure
events.description: act of reorganizing the legal, ownership, operational, or other structures of a company
events.ta1explanation: Company restructures to avoid bankruptcy

events.name: Mergers and Acquistions
events.description: Mergers and Acquistions container
events.ta1explanation: Process to merge or be acquired by another company

events.name: Reorganization
events.description: Reorganization container
events.ta1explanation: Legal process after M&A or filing bankruptcy

events.name: Bankruptcy
events.description: Bankruptcy container
events.ta1explanation: Process in which a business files bankruptcy

events.name: Antitrust investigation
events.description: Antitrust investigation container
events.ta1explanation: The government may sue a business if they have reason to believe the business is becoming a monopoly

events.name: Found a business
events.description: action of creating an organization or other entity intended to endure
events.ta1explanation: A person founds a business

events.name: Private funding
events.description: act of providing resources
events.ta1explanation: Company is funded by private investors

events.name: Go public and sell IPOs
events.description: transfer of equivalent goods to each other
events.ta1explanation: Company goes public and lists stock on the public market

events.name: Privatize
events.description: transfer of equivalent goods to each other
events.ta1explanation: Company goes private and sells all their stock to a private equity firm

events.name: Create partnership
events.description: arrangement in which parties agree to cooperate to advance their mutual interests
events.ta1explanation: Two companies form a partnership, but remain separate entities

events.name: Charity fraud
events.description: act of using deception to get money from people who believe they are making donations to charities
events.ta1explanation: Using deception to get money from individuals believing they are making donations to legitimate charity organizations, especially charities representing victims of natural disasters shortly after the incident occurs.

events.name: Internet auction fraud
events.description: intentional deception made for unfair or unlawful gain or damaging or depriving a victim
events.ta1explanation: A fraudulent transaction or exchange that occurs in the context of an online auction site.

events.name: Nondelivery of merchandise
events.description: intentional deception made for unfair or unlawful gain or damaging or depriving a victim
events.ta1explanation: Fraud occurring when a payment is sent but the goods and services ordered are never received.

events.name: Nonpayment of funds
events.description: intentional deception made for unfair or unlawful gain or damaging or depriving a victim
events.ta1explanation: Fraud occurring when goods and services are shipped or rendered but payment for them is never received.

events.name: Overpayment scheme
events.description: confidence trick designed to prey upon victims good faith
events.ta1explanation: An individual is sent a payment significantly higher than an owed amount and is instructed to deposit the money in their bank account and wire transfer the excess funds back to the bank of the individual or company that sent it.

events.name: Reshipment scheme
events.description: intentional deception made for unfair or unlawful gain or damaging or depriving a victim
events.ta1explanation: An individual is recruited to receive merchandise at their place of residence and subsequently repackage the items for shipment, usually abroad.

events.name: Accusation
events.ta1explanation: act of accusing or charging another with a crime

events.name: Detention
events.ta1explanation: removal of the freedom of liberty by a state

events.name: Conviction
events.ta1explanation: verdict that results when a court of law finds a defendant guilty of a crime

events.name: Plea
events.ta1explanation: answer to a claim made by someone in a criminal case under common law using the adversarial system

events.name: Trial
events.ta1explanation: coming together of parties to a dispute, to present information in a tribunal

events.name: Legal hearing
events.ta1explanation: A legal hearing

events.name: Court decision
events.ta1explanation: formal decision made by a court

events.name: Sentence
events.ta1explanation: decree of punishment in law

events.name: Fine the business
events.description: financial penalty
events.ta1explanation: Government fines the business

events.name: Break up the business
events.description: act of separating one entity to form several
events.ta1explanation: Government breaks company up into multiple, smaller companies

events.name: Arrest executive
events.description: detention of a person and taking it into custody, usually because it has been suspected of committing or planning a crime
events.ta1explanation: Goverment arrests an executive of the company

events.name: Parole
events.description: provisional release from prison, with certain conditions such as probation in some states
events.ta1explanation: Executive goes on parole

events.name: Release from Jail
events.description: process of releasing an inmate from prison
events.ta1explanation: Executive is officially released

events.name: Acquittal
events.ta1explanation: the legal result of a verdict of not guilty

events.name: End partnership
events.description: termination of something
events.ta1explanation: Two companies end their partnership

events.name: Declining trend
events.description: thing or behavior that achieves intense short-lived popularity and then fades away
events.ta1explanation: Company adopted a trend that fades away

events.name: Economic recession
events.description: business cycle contraction; general slowdown in economic activity
events.ta1explanation: Recession affects company's sales

events.name: New competitor
events.description: rivalry between organisms, animals, individuals, groups, etc., for mutually incompatible goals
events.ta1explanation: A new company joins the market and the current company suffers

events.name: Contact suitable company
events.description: act of conveying intended meanings from one entity or group to another through the use of mutually understood signs and rules
events.ta1explanation: A company contacts a candidate company to propose merge / acquisition

events.name: Valuation analysis
events.description: process of estimating what something is worth, used in the finance industry
events.ta1explanation: Company performs valuation on the candidate company

events.name: Negotiate terms
events.description: act of conveying intended meanings from one entity or group to another through the use of mutually understood signs and rules
events.ta1explanation: Companies negotiate terms of merge / acquisition

events.name: Due diligence
events.description: investigation or exercise of care that a reasonable business or personis normally expected to take before entering into an agreement orcontract with another party or an act with a certain standard of care
events.ta1explanation: Company performs due diligence on candidate company

events.name: Purchase and sale contract
events.description: type of contract
events.ta1explanation: Companies sign a contract and officially merge / become acquired

events.name: Apply for reorganization
events.description: act of asking politely or formally for something
events.ta1explanation: Company officially applies for reorganization

events.name: Reorganization approval
events.description: expression granting permission to proceed with a proposal
events.ta1explanation: Government approves the reorganization

events.name: Reorganization rejection
events.description: act of declining to accept an item for approval, consideration, marking etc.
events.ta1explanation: Government rejects the reorganization

events.name: Terminate contracts and leases
events.description: termination of something
events.ta1explanation: Company terminates some contracts and leases

events.name: Recover assets
events.description: winding-up of a company
events.ta1explanation: Liquidate or re-use some assets

events.name: Repay some debt
events.description: transfer of an item of value from one party (such as a person orcompany) to another, in exchange for goods or services or to fulfill alegal obligation
events.ta1explanation: Company repays some debt to its creditors

events.name: Contact Attorney
events.description: act of conveying intended meanings from one entity or group to another through the use of mutually understood signs and rules
events.ta1explanation: Government contacts attorney to begin filing a lawsuit

events.name: File Complaint
events.ta1explanation: Plaintiff files a complaint to initiate a lawsuit

events.name: Answer
events.ta1explanation: In law, a solemn assertion in opposition to someone or something by the defendant

events.name: Discovery
events.ta1explanation: Pre-trial procedure in common law countries for obtaining evidence

events.name: Motion
events.ta1explanation: In US law, a procedural device to bring a limited, contested issue before a court for decision

events.name: Mediation
events.ta1explanation: Dispute resolution with assistance of an impartial third party moderator throughthe use of communication and negotiation techniques

events.name: Settlement
events.ta1explanation: The dispute is resolved through a payment of money.

events.name: Trial
events.ta1explanation: Coming together of parties to a dispute, to present information in a tribunal

events.name: Judgement
events.ta1explanation: The formal decision made by a court following a lawsuit

events.name: Appeal
events.ta1explanation: Resort to a superior court to review the decision of an inferior court or administrative agency

events.name: Apply for bankruptcy
events.description: act of asking politely or formally for something
events.ta1explanation: Company officially applies for bankruptcy

events.name: Bankruptcy approval
events.description: expression granting permission to proceed with a proposal
events.ta1explanation: Government approves the bankruptcy

events.name: Bankruptcy rejection
events.description: act of declining to accept an item for approval, consideration, marking etc.
events.ta1explanation: Government rejects the bankruptcy

events.name: Government bail out
events.description: transfer of money that must be repaid
events.ta1explanation: Government lends company money, because the company bankruptcy would damage the economy

events.name: Appoint trustee
events.description: action which designates a person to carry out a function(s) as a public official
events.ta1explanation: Government appoints a trustee to oversee the reorganization

events.name: Divestment
events.description: reduction of some kind of asset for financial, ethical, or political objectives or sale of an existing business by a firm
events.ta1explanation: Trustee liquidates assets

events.name: Transfer Assets
events.description: in property law, the transfer of ownership of a thing from one person to another
events.ta1explanation: Trustee distributes assets to creditors

events.name: Management change
events.description: process, event or action that deviates from the present state
events.ta1explanation: A new CEO or executive is hired

events.name: Hire new talent
events.description: relationship between the employee and the employer
events.ta1explanation: Company hires new talent

events.name: Dismiss employees
events.description: termination of employment decided unilaterally by employer
events.ta1explanation: Company fires some employees
